messages.message:
Hi team, I’m having trouble connecting to DB on local setup, I get the following error on core-service, job-service etc.,  The parameter `INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS`  is set correctly in the generated file at `/core-services/core-platform-service/tmp/env_local`  - any tips on how to resolve this?

```[INTERNAL]: Fail to query DB (Err: dpoPool_create user=dbuser extAuth=0: ORA-12154: TNS:could not resolve the connect identifier specified)```
@Abhishek Adupa  Can you send the value from `env_local` to me? I'll take a look.
BTW, that error message is an Oracle one, which should only appear if you're connecting to Dogfood. My guess is that INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS in evn_local is malformed in some way.

For reference, here is my config (for crafting):

```cs/mfichman❯ grep INSTABASE_BACKEND tmp/env_local
export INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS='--dialect=mysql --port=3306 --hostname=127.0.0.1 --username=root --database=ibdb'```
I’m following the value set here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wPDKwGM4Vu3LrUc_WrnpClCAw6XxmP8gXHNoCg-ru7Q/edit), it is dogfood DB and I’m not on crafting.
are you running the go services via docker or directly locally?
@Abhishek Adupa I can help you tomorrow with this. Sure it’s simple misconfiguration somewhere :)
@Abhishek Adupa I can help you tomorrow with this. Sure it’s simple misconfiguration somewhere :)
